data.title: the Degree Confluence Project
meta_keywords: degree confluence latitude longitude photographs maps intersect intersections
data.meta_description: The Degree Confluence Project contains photographs of the intersections of integer latitude and longitude degree lines.
data.text:
The goal of the project is to visit each of the latitude and longitude integer degree intersections in the world, and to take pictures at each location. The pictures, and stories about the visits, will then be posted here.

Overview

The project is an organized sampling of the world. There is a confluence within 49 miles (79 km) of you if you're on the surface of Earth. We've discounted confluences in the oceans and some near the poles, but there are still 9,685 to be found.

You're invited to help by visiting and photographing any one of these places. Read the Information pages, and contact us if you have questions. 25 confluences (14 new) in one journey

During 4400 km journey on Northern Kazakhstan Valera and Denis visited 25 confluences, 14 of them were new-visited. It took only 6 days. The story starts 53°N 76°E

4 new CPs in a remote European region

Two bikers Alexander Koptilkin and Alexander Evchenko have visited 4 new confluences in the remote forested region of North-East Europe. The story starts here
